It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which are typical of many species within its genus. It is native to specific regions in East Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
